div.head: CHAP. VI.
1 An exhortation to repentance. 4 A complaint of their vntowardnesse, and iniquitie.
div.ab: Come, and let vs returne vnto the Lord: for hee hath torne, and hee will heale vs: he hath smitten, and he will binde vs vp.
After two daies will he reuiue vs, in the third day he will raise vs vp, and we shall liue in his sight. 1.Cor.15. 4.
Then shal we know, if we follow on to know the Lord: his going forth is prepared, as the morning; & he shall come vnto vs, as the raine; as the latter and former raine vnto the earth.
Â¶ O Ephraim, what shall I doe vnto thee? O Iudah, what shall I do vnto thee? for your goodnesse is as a morning cloud, and as the early dew it goeth away. Or, mercy, or, kindnesse.
Therefore haue I shewed them by the Prophets: I haue slaine them by the wordes of my mouth, and thy iudgements are as the light that goeth foorth. Or, that thy iudgements might be, &c.
For I desired mercie, and not sacrifice; and the knowledge of God more then burnt offerings. Matth.9. 13. and 10. 7. eccles. 4. 17. 1.sam. 15.22.
But they like men haue transgressed the Couenant: there haue they dealt treacherously against me. Or, like Adam.
Gilead is a city of them that worke iniquitie; and is polluted with blood. Or, cunning for blood.
And as troupes of robbers waite for a man, so the company of priestes murther in the way by consent: for they commit lewdnesse. Hebr. with one shoulder. Or, to Sichem. , Or, enormitie.
I haue seene an horrible thing in the house of Israel: there is the whoredome of Ephraim, Israel is defiled.
Also O Iudah, hee hath set an haruest for thee, when I returned the captiuitie of my people.
